RecipeSteps: For the beurre blanc, start by crushing the saffron threads either using a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder.  Combine 2 ounces of wine and the crushed saffron threads and let sit for a couple of minutes.

Add remaining white wine, saffron wine mixture, shallot, lemon juice, a dash of salt and pepper to a medium saucepan.  Bring the mixture to a boil and let reduce until there is about a tablespoon left.  Add the cream and let it cook for about 1 minute.
Remove the pan from heat and start adding butter one cube at a time, whisking well after each piece is added.  Taste the sauce and add more salt and pepper if needed.

For the scallops, heat a heavy saut√© pan over medium-high heat.  Add one tablespoon of oil and swirl the pan to coat evenly.  Add the scallops to the pan and let cook for 2 minutes.  Turn over scallops and let cook another 1-2 minutes, until done.
For serving, pour about 2-3 tablespoons of saffron beurre blanc into the bottom of a small plate.  Place 2 scallops on each plate.  Garnish with chopped chives.
The base of this beurre blanc sauce was inspired by Alton Brown's Raymound Beurre Blanc recipe.
AllRecipeTips: Saffron is often expensive and hard to find.  It is important to remember that a little will go a long way.  I highly recommend The Spanish Table online store for stocking up on saffron as well as other Spanish specialties.
